page.title: 01Dumfries-shire farmland
page.content: An entirely agricultural area on the edge of the valley of the river Nith. The land is undulating,with a spine of high land through the middle of the block. Part is wooded with a mixtue of deciduous and coniferous trees. Most of the remaining land is used for both crop production and for grazing cattle and sheep but the higher section along the spine is used for grazing only. Four farms control most of the area between them. The biggest employs a few staff, the others rely on the farming family alone.The main products are milk, wood and beef, much of the crops (wheat, oats, hay mostly) being used for animal feed on te farm where it is grown. Mechanical power is much used, the tractors probably out number the people. The only non-agricultural intrusions are radio masts on hazel shaw hill.
